properties.areaDesc: Straits of Florida from west end of Seven Mile Bridge to south of Halfmoon Shoal out 20 NM; Straits of Florida from Halfmoon Shoal to 20 NM west of Dry Tortugas out 20 NM; Gulf of Mexico from West End of Seven Mile Bridge to Halfmoon Shoal out to 5 Fathoms; Gulf of Mexico including Dry Tortugas and Rebecca Shoal Channel; Straits of Florida from Halfmoon Shoal to 20 NM west of Dry Tortugas 20 to 60 NM out; Hawk Channel from west end of Seven Mile Bridge to Halfmoon Shoal out to the reef
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued February 1 at 10:45AM EST until February 1 at 11:15AM EST by NWS Key West FL
properties.description:
For the following areas...
Hawk Channel and Straits of Florida from west end of Seven Mile
Bridge to 20 nm west of Dry Tortugas out 20 nm...
Gulf of Mexico from west end of Seven Mile Bridge to Halfmoon Shoal
out to 5 fathoms...
Gulf of Mexico including Dry Tortugas and Rebecca Shoal Channel...
Straits of Florida from Halfmoon Shoal to 20 nm west of Dry Tortugas
out 60 nm...

At 1044 AM EST, strong thunderstorms with possible waterspouts were
located along a line extending from near Rebecca Shoal Light to 23 nm
south of Tortugas Ecological Reserve South, moving east at 25 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts 34 knots or greater.

SOURCE...National Weather Service Meteorologist.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can quickly form and capsize boats, cause
considerable damage to vessels and create suddenly higher
waves. Expect wind gusts in excess of 34 knots, suddenly
higher waves, frequent lightning, and heavy downpours.

Locations in the warning include...
Twenty-Eight Foot Shoal Light, Halfmoon Shoal Light and Marquesas
Keys.
properties.instruction:
Prepare for wind gusts in excess of 35 knots, steep and fast-building
seas, frequent lightning strikes, and blinding downpours. Stay low or
go below, and make sure all on board are wearing life jackets.

NWSheadline: A SPECIAL MARINE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EST
